title: Germán Olano Airport
text:
Germán Olano Airport (, ) is an <a href="airport">airport</a> serving <a href="Puerto%20Carre%C3%B1o">Puerto Carreño</a>, the capital of <a href="Vichada%20Department">Vichada Department</a> in <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>. It is also known as Puerto Carreño Airport ("Aeropuerto Puerto Carreño"). The airport is west of and parallels the <a href="Orinoco%20River">Orinoco River</a>, locally Colombia's border with <a href="Venezuela">Venezuela</a>.
The Puerto Carreno <a href="non-directional%20beacon">non-directional beacon</a> (Ident: PCR) and <a href="VOR-DME">VOR-DME</a> (Ident: PTC) are located on the field.
Accidents and incidents.
On December 20, 2016, <a href="Aerosucre%20Flight%20157">Aerosucre Flight 157</a> crashed while taking off from the airport after failing to become airborne. It was reported that 5 aboard the Boeing 727-200 died, and 1 crew member survived with injuries.
